0: Saudi Arabia's oil minister says the OPEC powerhouse's readiness to boost oil output is not linked to sanctions that could affect Iran's oil exports. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Ali Al-Naimi was quoted by the Saudi daily Al-Ektisadiya on Sunday as saying the oil-rich kingdom was ready to use its spare production capacity to fill any market need. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR But he said earlier pledges to boost output as needed were not linked to global worries over U.S. and potential European Union sanctions affecting Iranian oil exports. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The comments come as Iran's OPEC governor was quoted Sunday warning Arab oil producers
